intro: Impatiens rheedei, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant has heart-shaped leaves that are often velvety to the touch, and it typically grows as an herbaceous perennial. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and requires indirect sunlight to flourish. Impatiens rheedei is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and ease of care.
